Also I noticed that indexer became much slower than it was a couple of days ago.

(In reply to comment #1)
> Also I noticed that indexer became much slower than it was a couple of days
> ago.

As we previously reported somewhere (I can't remember if we did it on the cdt-dev list or in a bug report), the indexer is now 50% slower. We've implemented some caching to cut the memory requirement down. We still need to document how to configure the cache size and look at ways of making it faster (if possible).

What time are you getting for a reindex?
I wouldn't trust current timing due to the very high number of exceptions. I was getting exceptions every two seconds on average.

(In reply to comment #1)
> Also I noticed that indexer became much slower than it was a couple of days
> ago.

I posted a short info on that here:
http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/cdt-dev/msg09277.html

> I wouldn't trust current timing due to the very high number of exceptions. I

from where these occur in the code, it looks like constructing a test case could be quite hard - would it be possible to send some example code for the failures?

Please download a test case from:
http://briefcase.yahoo.com/bc/prigogin@pacbell.net/vwp2?.tok=bceaX2YBNGbpD28k&.dir=/Eclipse&.dnm=cdttest.zip&.src=bc

It is too big to attach to Bugzilla. It's the same test case as for bug 175470.
This is a major bug due to the number of thrown exceptions.

I have a few fixes for function templates in my workspace and the provided test case indexes without any exceptions.  I can't isolate these fixes from the rest of my work so this bug will be fixed after my next patch for Bug #167098 (later this week).
Sergey, can you confirm that this exception is no longer thrown with the latest from HEAD?
Marking as fixed since this exception does not happen any more with HEAD.
Setting to milestone 4.0 so we can generate a report of all bugs fixed in 4.0.
